abstract: On Monday, South Africa for the Group of 77 and China (G-77/China), Australia for the Umbrella Group, Dominica for the Bolivarian Alliance for the Peoples of Our America (ALBA), Guatemala for the Independent Association of Latin America and the Caribbean (AILAC), Sudan for the African Group, and El Salvador for the Central American Integration System (SICA), delivered general statements.

title: ADP CONTACT GROUP
topics: Post-Kyoto Agreements|UNFCCC and Kyoto Protocol Functioning
abstract: On Friday afternoon, ADP Co-Chair Djoghlaf opened the closing session of the contact group.

title: CLOSING PLENARY
topics: Post-Kyoto Agreements|UNFCCC and Kyoto Protocol Functioning
abstract: The closing plenary immediately followed the closure of the ADP contact group.

title: A TALE OF BRIDGES
abstract: …it was the epoch of belief, it was the epoch of incredulity… Before ADP 2-10, there was general agreement on the urgent need for progress in order to reach an agreement in Paris in December.

title: COPENHAGEN
abstract: The UN Climate Change Conference in Copenhagen, Denmark, took place in December 2009.

title: A TALE OF TWELVE SECTIONS
abstract: …we had everything before us, we had nothing before us… At the start of ADP 2-10, parties had the building blocks of the Paris package before them―a compilation text including all parties’ views and a Co-Chairs’ Tool categorizing the text into three parts.

title: A TALE OF THREE PROCESSES
abstract: …it was the age of wisdom, it was the age of foolishness… Many recognized that the technical negotiations forming the shape of any Paris agreement are insufficient to deliver a final deal without higher political guidance.

title: A TALE OF TWO CITIES
abstract: …it was the season of Light, it was the season of Darkness… For many, one of the most important outcomes of the meeting was the broad mandate given on Friday to the Co-Chairs to produce a new non-paper, comprising a negotiating text.

title: CANCUN
topics: Post-Kyoto Agreements 2|Financial Mechanisms and Funds|Post-Kyoto Agreements|forests|Mitigation|Adaptation
abstract: The UN Climate Change Conference in Cancun, Mexico, took place in December 2010, where parties finalized the Cancun Agreements and extended the mandates of the two AWGs for another year.

title: DURBAN
abstract: The UN Climate Change Conference in Durban, South Africa, took place in November and December 2011.

title: DOHA
abstract: The UN Climate Change Conference in Doha, Qatar, took place in November and December 2012.

title: WARSAW
topics: Financial Mechanisms and Funds 2|Post-Kyoto Agreements|Loss and Damage
abstract: The UN Climate Change Conference in Warsaw, Poland, took place in November 2013.

title: LIMA
abstract: The UN Climate Change Conference in Lima, Peru, took place in December 2014.

title: ADP 2-8
abstract: ADP 2-8 took place in February 2015, in Geneva, Switzerland.

title: IPCC-34
abstract: This meeting (18-19 November 2011, Kampala, Uganda) adopted revised Procedures for the Preparation, Review, Acceptance, Adoption, Approval and Publication of IPCC Reports, as well as Implementation Procedures and the Disclosure Form for the COI Policy.

title: IPCC-35
abstract: This session (6-9 June 2012, Geneva, Switzerland) concluded the Panel’s consideration of the recommendations from the IAC Review by approving the functions of the IPCC Secretariat and TSUs, and the Communications Strategy.

title: IPCC-37
topics: Vulnerabilities and Impacts|National Communications and Inventories
abstract: During this session (14-17 October 2013, Batumi, Georgia), the Panel decided to establish a Task Group on the Future Work of the IPCC.

title: IPCC-40
abstract: This meeting (27 October - 1 November 2014, Copenhagen, Denmark) considered and finalized the SYR, which integrates the findings from the three IPCC WGs.

title: IPCC-41
topics: IPCC Governance|UNFCCC and Kyoto Protocol Functioning
abstract: This meeting (24-27 February 2015, Nairobi, Kenya) addressed the future work of the IPCC, including the recommendations of the Task Group on the Future Work of the IPCC, and took a decision on the size, structure and composition of the IPCC Bureau and TFB.

title: ADOPTION OF THE AGENDA
abstract: Acting IPCC Secretary Bruce Stewart presented the agenda for the session (IPCC-XLII/Doc.1 Rev.2 and Add.1).

title: IPCC PRODUCTS
topics: IPCC Governance|Vulnerabilities and Impacts|National Communications and Inventories
abstract: Since its inception, the IPCC has prepared a series of comprehensive assessment reports, special reports and technical papers that provide scientific information on climate change to the international community and are subject to extensive review by experts and governments.

title: COMMUNICATION AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES
abstract: On Monday afternoon, Jonathan Lynn, Head, Communications and Media Relations, IPCC Secretariat, reported on this item (IPCC-XLII/INF.11), noting that the focus this year had been on outreach related to AR5.

title: IPCC SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAMME
abstract: On Monday afternoon, Acting IPCC Secretary Stewart reported on this item (IPCC-XLII/INF.10), thanking the Prince Albert II of Monaco and Cuomo Foundations for their contributions.

title: EXPERT MEETING ON SCENARIOS
abstract: WGIII Co-Chair Ramón Pichs-Madruga (Cuba) reported on this Expert Meeting (IPCC-XLII/INF.15) held in Laxenburg, Austria, in May 2015, which resulted in recommendations for both the IPCC and for the scenario research community.

title: EXPERT MEETING ON CLIMATE CHANGE, FOOD AND AGRICULTURE
abstract: WGII Co-Chair Chris Field (US) reported on this Expert Meeting, held in Dublin, Ireland from 27-29 May 2015 (IPCC.XLII/INF.12, Corr.2).

title: TASK GROUP ON DATA AND SCENARIO SUPPORT FOR IMPACTS AND CLIMATE ANALYSIS (TGICA)
abstract: On Monday afternoon, the Panel considered the report on TGICA activities (IPCC-XLII/INF.14), including on: TGICA-22; the Expert Meeting on Decision-Centered Approaches to the Use of Climate Change Information; and the Clinic to Work Through Real World Cases Brought by Participants.

title: TFI
abstract: The Expert Meeting for Technical Assessment of IPCC Inventory Guidelines (Energy, Industrial Processes and Product Use, and Waste Sectors) (IPCC-XLII/INF.7 Corr.2 and IPCC-XLII/INF.9 Corr.2), the Expert Meeting for Technical Assessment of IPCC Inventory Guidelines (Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Use Sector) (IPCC-XLII/INF.8 Corr.2 and IPCC-XLII/INF.9 Corr.2) and the Expert Meeting to Collect Emission Factor Database and Software Users’ Feedback (IPCC-XLII/INF.

title: WORKSHOP ON REGIONAL CLIMATE PROJECTIONS AND THEIR USE IN IMPACTS AND RISK ANALYSIS STUDIES
abstract: On Monday afternoon, WGI Co-Chair Stocker reported on this workshop (IPCC-XLII/INF.18), which took place from 15-18 September 2015, in São Paulo, Brazil.

title: UPDATE ON THE DECISION PATHWAY FOR CONSIDERATION OF REQUESTS FROM RESEARCHERS FOR ACCESS TO NON-PUBLIC MATERIAL OR MEETINGS
abstract: On Monday afternoon, WGIII Co-Chair Pichs-Madruga reported on this Update (IPCC-XLII/INF.17), which was submitted by the Acting IPCC Secretary and prepared by the Co-Chairs of WGIII.

title: COI
abstract: On Monday morning, Acting IPCC Chair El Gizouli reported that the IPCC COI Committee (IPCC-XLII/INF.

title: NOMINATIONS COMMITTEE
abstract: The Nominations Committee was appointed on Monday and consisted of the following members: Alab Sile Sikhosans (Swaziland), Lamin Mai Touray (the Gambia), Abdullah Tawlah (Saudi Arabia), Syed Atif Raza (Pakistan), José Luis Remedi (Uruguay), Jacqueline Spence (Jamaica), Antonio Cañas Calderón (El Salvador), Dan Zwartz (New Zealand), Gary Theseira (Malaysia), Ivan Čačić (Croatia) and Katrine Krogh Andersen (Denmark).

title: IPCC-28
abstract: During this session (9-10 April 2008, Budapest, Hungary), the IPCC agreed to prepare AR5 and to retain the current structure of its WGs.

title: CREDENTIALS COMMITTEE
abstract: The Credentials Committee was appointed on Monday and comprised the following six members: Djé Kouakou Bernard (Côte d’Ivoire); Ali Shareef (Maldives); Liliam Ballon (Peru); Alessandro Nardi (US); Arona Ngari (Cook Islands); and Dovilė Vaitkutė (Lithuania).

title: ELECTIONS OF THE CHAIR OF THE IPCC
abstract: On Tuesday evening, the Panel voted for the IPCC Chair for the sixth assessment cycle.

title: ELECTIONS OF THE VICE-CHAIRS OF THE IPCC
abstract: On Wednesday morning, Acting IPCC Chair El Gizouli opened voting for the IPCC Vice-Chairs.

title: ELECTIONS FOR THE CO-CHAIRS OF THE WORKING GROUPS AND THE TASK FORCE BUREAU
topics: IPCC Governance|UNFCCC and Kyoto Protocol Functioning
abstract: Elections for WG Co-Chairs were held on Wednesday afternoon.

title: ELECTIONS FOR THE VICE-CHAIRS OF THE WGS AND TFB
abstract: On Thursday morning, the Panel elected the WG Vice-Chairs.

title: IPCC-29
abstract: This session (31 August – 4 September 2008, Geneva, Switzerland) commemorated the IPCC’s 20th anniversary.

title: IPCC-30
abstract: During this session (21-23 April 2009, Antalya, Turkey), the Panel focused mainly on the near-term future of the IPCC and provided guidance for an AR5 scoping meeting, which was held in Venice, Italy, from 13-17 July 2009.

title: IPCC-31
abstract: This session (26-29 October 2009, Bali, Indonesia) approved the proposed AR5 chapter outlines.

title: INTERACADEMY COUNCIL (IAC) REVIEW
abstract: In response to public criticism of the IPCC related to inaccuracies in AR4 and the Panel’s response to the criticism, UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon and IPCC Chair Pachauri requested the IAC to conduct an independent review of IPCC processes and procedures and to present recommendations to strengthen the IPCC and to ensure the quality of its reports.

title: IPCC-32
abstract: This session (11-14 October 2010, Busan, Republic of Korea) addressed the recommendations of the IAC Review.

title: IPCC-33
abstract: The session (10-13 May 2011, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates) focused primarily on follow-up actions to the IAC Review.
